struct.name: basic_cstring_ref
struct.purpose: Small wrapper for a null-terminated string that can be directly passed to C APIS.

description.para: This ref can only be modified by moving the front pointer. It does not store the size, but can detect values that can directly be passed to system APIs.
It can be constructed from a char* pointer or any class that has a c_str() member function, e.g. std::string or boost::static_string.
This launcher will be used by process if a process is launched through the constructor:

struct.name: process_environment
struct.purpose: Initializer for the environment of sub process.

description.para: This will set the environment in a subprocess:
The environment initializer will persist it's state, so that it can be used multiple times. Do however note the the Operating System is allowed to modify the internal state.

parameter.paramtype: typename std::enable_if< std::is_convertible< decltype(*std::begin(std::declval< Args >())), cstring_ref >::value >::type *

struct.name: current_view
struct.purpose: A view object for the current environment of this process.

description.para: The view might (windows) or might not (posix) be owning; if it owns it will deallocate the on destruction, like a unique_ptr.
Note that accessing the environment in this way is not thread-safe.

struct.name: key
struct.purpose: A class representing a key within an environment.

parameter.name: raw
parameter.paramtype: const typename conditional< is_same< value_type, char >::value, wchar_t, char >::type *

parameter.name: raw
parameter.paramtype: const typename conditional< is_same< value_type, char >::value, wchar_t, char >::type *

struct.name: key_value_pair_view
struct.purpose: A view for a key value pair in an environment.

struct.name: key_view
struct.purpose: A view type for a key of an environment.

parameter.name: raw
parameter.paramtype: const typename conditional< is_same< value_type, char >::value, wchar_t, char >::type *

struct.name: value_iterator
struct.purpose: The iterator used by a value or value_view to iterator through environments that are lists.

struct.name: value_view
struct.purpose: A view for a value in an environment.

typedef.name: key_char_traits
typedef.purpose: A char traits type that reflects the OS rules for string representing environment keys.

description.para: Can be an alias of std::char_traits. May only be defined for char and wchar_t.
Windows treats keys as case-insensitive yet perserving. The char traits are made to reflect that behaviour.

typedef.name: value_char_traits
typedef.purpose: A char traits type that reflects the OS rules for string representing environment values.

description.para: Can be an alias of std::char_traits. May only be defined for char and wchar_t.

typedef.name: char_type
typedef.purpose: The character type used by the environment. Either char or wchar_t.

typedef.name: native_handle
typedef.purpose: The native handle of an environment. Note that this can be an owning pointer and is generally not thread safe.

data-member.name: equality_sign
data-member.purpose: The equal character in an environment string used to separate key and value.

data-member.name: delimiter
data-member.purpose: The delimiter in environemtn lists. Commonly used by the PATH variable.

function.name: current
function.purpose: Obtain a handle to the current environment.

function.name: home

description.para: The environment to search. Defaults to the current environment of this process

function.purpose: Find the home folder in an environment-like type.

description.para: The environment type passed in must be a range with value T that fulfills the following requirements:
For T value

listitem.para: std::get<0>(value) must return a type comparable to key_view.
std::get<1>(value) must return a type convertible to filesystem::path.

returns.para: A filesystem::path to the home directory or an empty path if it cannot be found.

function.name: find_executable

description.para: The environment to search. Defaults to the current environment of this process

function.purpose: Find the executable name in an environment-like type.

description.para: The environment type passed in must be a range with value T that fulfills the following requirements:
For T value

listitem.para: std::get<0>(value) must return a type comparable to key_view.
std::get<1>(value) must return a type convertible to value_view.

returns.para: A filesystem::path to the executable or an empty path if it cannot be found.

overloaded-function.name: get
overloaded-function.purpose: Get an environment variable from the current process.

overloaded-function.name: set
overloaded-function.purpose: Set an environment variable for the current process.

overloaded-function.name: unset
overloaded-function.purpose: Remove an environment variable from the current process.

enum.name: utf8_conv_error
enum.purpose: Errors used for utf8 <-> UCS-2 conversions.

data-member.name: exit_code_category
data-member.purpose: An error category that can be used to interpret exit codes of subprocesses.

description.para: Currently not used by boost.process, but it might be in the future.
void run_my_process(filesystem::path pt, error_code & ec) { process proc(pt, {}); proc.wait(); ec.assign(proc.native_exit_code(), error::get_exit_code_category()); }

overloaded-function.name: execute

purpose.para: The asio executor of the process handle

description.para: The process to be run.

overloaded-function.purpose: Run a process and wait for it to complete.

returns.para: int The exit code of the process

throws.simpara: system_error An error that might have occured during the wait.

description.para: This function asynchronously for a process to complete.
Cancelling the execution will signal the child process to exit with the following intepretations:
It is to note that async_execute will us the lowest seelected cancellation type. A subprocess might ignore anything not terminal.

parameter.paramtype: (async_initiate< CompletionToken, signature >(declval< init_wrapper< typename decay< Initiation >::type > >(), declval< CompletionToken & >(), declval< BOOST_ASIO_MOVE_ARG(Args)>()...))

typedef.name: native_exit_code_type
typedef.purpose: The native exit-code type, usually an integral value.

description.para: The OS may have a value different from int to represent the exit codes of subprocesses. It might also contain additional information.

function.name: process_is_running
function.purpose: Check if the native exit code indicates the process is still running.

function.name: evaluate_exit_code
function.purpose: Obtain the portable part of the exit code, i.e. what the subprocess has returned from main.

function.name: current_pid
function.purpose: Get the process id of the current process.

struct.name: basic_popen
struct.purpose: A subprocess with automatically assigned pipes.

description.para: The purpose os the popen is to provide a convenient way to use the stdin & stdout of a process.
Popen can be used as a stream object in other protocols.

struct.name: rebind_executor
struct.purpose: Rebinds the popen type to another executor.

typedef.name: other
typedef.purpose: The pipe type when rebound to the specified executor.

typedef.name: stdin_type
typedef.purpose: The type used for stdin on the parent process side.

typedef.name: stdout_type
typedef.purpose: The type used for stdout on the parent process side.

method.name: get_stdin
method.purpose: Get the stdin pipe.

method.name: get_stdout
method.purpose: Get the stdout pipe.

method.name: get_stdin
method.purpose: Get the stdin pipe.

method.name: get_stdout
method.purpose: Get the stdout pipe.

method.name: write_some

description.para: One or more data buffers to be written to the pipe.

method.purpose: Write some data to the pipe.

description.para: This function is used to write data to the pipe. The function call will block until one or more bytes of the data has been written successfully, or until an error occurs.

note.para: The write_some operation may not transmit all of the data to the peer. Consider using the write function if you need to ensure that all data is written before the blocking operation completes.

formalpara.title: Example
formalpara.para: To write a single data buffer use the buffer function as follows: pipe.write_some(boost::asio::buffer(data, size)); See the buffer documentation for information on writing multiple buffers in one go, and how to use it with arrays, boost::array or std::vector.

throws.simpara: boost::system::system_error Thrown on failure. An error code of boost::asio::error::eof indicates that the connection was closed by the subprocess.

method.name: write_some

description.para: One or more data buffers to be written to the pipe.
Set to indicate what error occurred, if any.

method.purpose: Write some data to the pipe.

description.para: This function is used to write data to the pipe. The function call will block until one or more bytes of the data has been written successfully, or until an error occurs.

note.para: The write_some operation may not transmit all of the data to the subprocess. Consider using the write function if you need to ensure that all data is written before the blocking operation completes.

returns.para: The number of bytes written. Returns 0 if an error occurred.

method.name: BOOST_PROCESS_V2_INITFN_AUTO_RESULT_TYPE
method.purpose: Start an asynchronous write.

description.para: This function is used to asynchronously write data to the pipe. It is an initiating function for an asynchronous_operation, and always returns immediately.

note.para: The write operation may not transmit all of the data to the peer. Consider using the async_write function if you need to ensure that all data is written before the asynchronous operation completes.

formalpara.title: Example
formalpara.para: To write a single data buffer use the buffer function as follows: popen.async_write_some(boost::asio::buffer(data, size), handler); See the buffer documentation for information on writing multiple buffers in one go, and how to use it with arrays, boost::array or std::vector.

method.name: read_some

description.para: One or more buffers into which the data will be read.

method.purpose: Read some data from the pipe.

description.para: This function is used to read data from the pipe. The function call will block until one or more bytes of data has been read successfully, or until an error occurs.

note.para: The read_some operation may not read all of the requested number of bytes. Consider using the read function if you need to ensure that the requested amount of data is read before the blocking operation completes.

formalpara.title: Example
formalpara.para: To read into a single data buffer use the buffer function as follows: basic_readable_pipe.read_some(boost::asio::buffer(data, size)); See the buffer documentation for information on reading into multiple buffers in one go, and how to use it with arrays, boost::array or std::vector.

throws.simpara: boost::system::system_error Thrown on failure. An error code of boost::asio::error::eof indicates that the connection was closed by the peer.

method.name: read_some

description.para: One or more buffers into which the data will be read.
Set to indicate what error occurred, if any.

method.purpose: Read some data from the pipe.

description.para: This function is used to read data from the pipe. The function call will block until one or more bytes of data has been read successfully, or until an error occurs.

note.para: The read_some operation may not read all of the requested number of bytes. Consider using the read function if you need to ensure that the requested amount of data is read before the blocking operation completes.

returns.para: The number of bytes read. Returns 0 if an error occurred.

method.name: BOOST_PROCESS_V2_INITFN_AUTO_RESULT_TYPE
method.purpose: Start an asynchronous read.

description.para: This function is used to asynchronously read data from the pipe. It is an initiating function for an asynchronous_operation, and always returns immediately.

note.para: The read operation may not read all of the requested number of bytes. Consider using the async_read function if you need to ensure that the requested amount of data is read before the asynchronous operation completes.

formalpara.title: Example

description.para: A process handle is an unmanaged version of a process. This means it does not terminate the proces on destruction and will not keep track of the exit-code.
Note that the exit code might be discovered early, during a call to running. Thus it can only be discovered that process has exited already.

constructor.purpose: Move construct and rebind the executor.

description.para: This utility class parses command lines into tokens and allows users to executed based on textual inputs.
In v1, this was possible directly when starting a process, but has been removed based on the security risks associated with this.
By making the shell parsing explicity, it is encouraged that a user runs a sanity check on the executable before launching it.

method.name: args
method.purpose: Native representation of the arguments to be used - excluding the executable.

function.name: get_shell_category
function.purpose: Error category used by the shell parser.

struct.name: process_start_dir
struct.purpose: Initializer for the starting directory of a subprocess to be launched.

struct.name: process_stdio
struct.purpose: The initializer for the stdio of a subprocess.

description.para: The subprocess initializer has three members:

If the initializer is present all three will be set for the subprocess. By default they will inherit the stdio handles from the parent process. This means that this will forward stdio to the subprocess:
No constructors are provided in order to support designated initializers in later version of C++.
Valid initializers for any stdio are:

listitem.para: FILE* any open file, including stdin, stdout and stderr
a filesystem::path, which will open a readable or writable depending on the direction of the stream
native_handle any native file handle (HANDLE on windows) or file descriptor (int on posix)
any io-object with a .native_handle() function that is comptaiblie with the above. E.g. a asio::ip::tcp::socket
an asio::basic_writeable_pipe for stdin or asio::basic_readable_pipe for stderr/stdout.
